DZO4H8pIOUv2Q1-HDtMmeA.text: Singapore is a foodie's dream but if you are wanting some brief respite from the delicious local cuisine on offer you need to head to Do Main Deli & Bistrot.  My husband and I woke up craving a brunch fix and we were so happy when we came across this place.  There is a great selection of sandwiches, substantial main course type meals and lots of baked goodies too. The food is delicious, service excellent, and the surroundings very clean and pleasant.  To top off a wonderful brunch experience, when we were leaving the lovely lady behind the counter insisted we take a bag of baked delights with us "to enjoy during the rest your day"...how nice is that?!?

BRuoewPPixLSXSnT4LMd_g.text: Had a mother's day breakfast here.  Indeed quality of the baked goods are excellent.  Ambience is not bad certainly the french music at the background was an added complement.  Over the counter service staff was friendly and even bother to make small talk with us being the first customers at 8am.  Only thing that is holding me back for a 5 star is the pricing.  Otherwise they seem to have a good following even early on Sunday morning.  Not a place i will frequent every morning but when the craving for a nice croissant & breads - this be the place to grab some.Mar 10th '18Back again for lunch.   Glad to report all is good.   Got to say the rotisserie chicken is simply marvelous!!

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Buttery and flaky - better than Tiong bahru
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Nice cinnamon danish
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Oouch

2ddJrMzd5DcpmG045EMynA.text: Beautiful little French Boulangerie & café in a lovely area. They feature everything from the typical baguette to croissants to éclair au chocolat, sandwiches and tartes.. I had a hard time choosing and in the end went for a savoury croissant: a salted egg croissant, and a café au lait.Hearing the accent from the gentleman who served me I spoke French to him, which was great not having spoken it for some time. Also it proved the quality control for originality of the produce being in place :-)I could sense his hesitation regarding my croissant choice and offered a regular one instead but I needed to try the salted egg one and am glad I did.It arrived warm at my table and was just like a croissant should be, very buttery and crunchy, with a great cheese & egg sauce filling.The coffee was great, too, by the way :-)I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. great cafe au lait and salted egg croissant

9z71AvNb12IHCIzhMc538g.text: Pretty good pastries, but oh so expensive.The bread is baked fresh daily, and they serve everything from croissants to baguettes. The cakes and pastries are particularly enticing, including the eclairs, paris brest and cream puffs.Chef Frederic apprenticed at Lenôtre Paris and used to teach at Le cordon Bleu, so he definitely knows his stuff. You can see everyone at work at the kitchen at the back of the cafe. The only thing is that portions are small and the great food doesn't come cheap. It's S$15 for a small slice of quiche and S$8 for a tart... So my trips are occasional, when my wallet permits.

RKST5a8K4pM1ay4fSyn_oQ.text: Situated in the up & coming Tanjong Katong enclave (stone throw away from Joo Chiat & Katong), this French cafe is a gem!Only discovered it by chance a few months ago and spent a very leisurely Sun Arvo, reading my stuff & having a late brunch. It's a very popular cafe, but as seats are well spaced out, one doesn't feel claustrophobic.Ambience is perfect, with French music playing in the background. What I appreciate most is the room temperature water & cold water (in glass flasks) for patrons to help themselves.Their food is delicious too! They have a bakery attached, and one can see the bakers at work through the full glass wall separating the cafe & the bakery.Nearest MRT is Paya Lebar Station (EW green line). Take a 3-4 min cab ride here or u can take a couple of buses that stop very near to the cafe. Cafe is situated along the main road so it's v convenient. Lots of eateries and cafes in this stretch, so u can go cafe/eatery hopping once u want a change of scenery.

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Trying their new menu: chicken pie. Pretty good I say.
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. So yummy
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Full brekkie

cLCyIh1HWPdyO4pfv4ym1w.text: Great neighborhood cafe with lots of French goodies (pour les français viennoiseries). But I think what took the cake is the mac and cheese. Best mac and cheese in Singapore?

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Best mac and cheese in Singapore?

us0bc547yamyM_9hEfripg.text: Le cordon bleu chef helms this quaint little cafe located along the bustling Tanjong Katong Road. Sat down to a post work treat (pain au chocolat with a latte) & fell in love with the flaky chewiness of the pastry. Took away a baguette for the boyfriend and I as well, but the smell is too much ... I may be tempted to take a bite (or ten!) before I get to his place tonight!Pricey, just a little bit, but nothing new in the little red dot.

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore

DIeHxmGIcTy5hdHsrfhBng.text: The Tartiflette "Reblochon" $16 (Oven baked Cheese, Potatoes, Bacon) was one of the ala carte dishes that melted my heart instantly. I could slowly savour the cheesy goodness as the pud remained in a semi-liquid form right to the very final lick. The baked baked escargots $16 here are good too. Plump, tender and fresh, these are unlike their frozen limpid counterparts served at other places in Singapore. Other French bistro favourites include the Broken Egg (Plain $12/Cream Bacon $15 /Tomato) that is served with Mouilllettes aka toasts soldiers. I doubt anyone will have a problem clearing the assorted bread basket as the bread is truly a mark of the chef's expertise. It would be foolish not to grab some of the excellent sweets here as well. I highly recommend the macarons that were in a supreme class of its own. The light delicate shells crackle as one bites into it and next comes the moment when the mouth is pleasantly violated with the luscious fillings. I am obsessed with the Peanut Butter Caramel, which tastes like a royal marriage of Snickers bar and Skippy Creamy Peanut Butter. The Coconut is also unbelievably fragrant and divine. Same goes for the dark potent Chocolate. At $2 per piece/$6 per pack, I must confessed that these are definitely a steal and perhaps more enjoyable than the ones from Patisserie G and even Laduree. Another must-try is the Cream Puff ($5). Or more precisely, a chouquette puff that looks deceivingly small but sublimely overloaded with almost unsweetened vanilla cream filling. Unmasked by the sugar, this is one rare moment when I could really taste the pure flavors of the dairy.

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore

fGJt1gs2SQHUIbiTlWpUow.text: So good!Helmed by a French Chef used to teach baking at Le Cordon Bleu, so he is definitely legit, and you can tell from the pastries!We have tried a variety of baked goods and liked all of them. Classic baguette - yummy and crusty. Loaves with cheese or pancetta, olives - how to not love! And did I mention quiches too?If you decide to drop in for a sit down brunch, they also serve up a variety of brunch dishes like croque Monsieur. You can also get them to heat up any other pastries like we love our pain Au chocolat lightly roasted.Took one star off as the pricing is on the high side. But that isn't stopping me from returning since it is right in the hood!

photos.caption: Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Classic French bakery
Photo of Do.Main Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Croque Monsieur

DVGdGZp8WGhMNLf8rg8Ibg.text: Probably the best bakery in the east, serves great quiches, soups and chocolate croissants. Coffee is great too. Really nice ambience and somehow never too crowded. I've literally never had a bad experience here.

rLS6akQqIFtWUO6ISImgcQ.text: Good bread, though the baker has a personality of a wet sandwich. I showed up 10 minutes before opening time and it seemed a HUGE ask to buy a baguette. I would rather spend my money with the nicer folks at the Bread Project.

Yk2o4fU_Iz5690kc2gSL2A.text: I love this place.  I have been disappointed so many times with bakeries with decent reviews but I was totally and utterly impressed by this place!!!! It's a bit far from me but I know I'll be back often.  Great French loaf baguette, croissant and croque mousier.   Oh how I love thee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
